Case.Subject: Unable to access reporting dashboard after latest update
Case.Description: Users in the Finance department are unable to access the reporting dashboard. Error message: 'Session expired. Please log in again.' This started occurring immediately after the platform update on 1 Nov 2025.

Comments.Body: Thank you for reporting this issue. I've reviewed the logs and can see session tokens are expiring prematurely for users accessing the reporting module. This appears to be related to the v2.5.1 update. Escalating to Engineering for investigation.

Root cause identified: The session timeout configuration was inadvertently changed during the deployment. We're preparing a hotfix (v2.5.2) to restore the correct timeout value. Expected deployment: 4 Nov 2025.
Hotfix v2.5.2 has been deployed to production. Please test the reporting dashboard and confirm the issue is resolved. Monitoring system logs for any further occurrences.
Confirmed - Finance team can now access the reporting dashboard without issues. Thank you for the quick turnaround!

Case.ResolutionSummary: Session timeout configuration was corrected via hotfix v2.5.2. Monitoring for 48 hours before closing.
Case.NextSteps: Monitor system logs and user feedback for 48 hours. If no further issues reported, case will be closed.

RelatedArticles.Title: KB-001234: Session Management Best Practices
RelatedArticles.Summary: Guidelines for configuring session timeouts and security policies

RelatedArticles.Title: KB-005678: Reporting Dashboard Troubleshooting
RelatedArticles.Summary: Common issues and solutions for the reporting dashboard module

SatisfactionSurvey.Feedback: Excellent support! The team identified and resolved the issue quickly. Very impressed with the communication throughout the process.

data.ReportFooter: This case report is confidential and intended for internal use only.
